isis.stitle: DT 466 / DT 570 / HT 570 Diesel Engine Diagnostic Manual - 2004 Emissions with EGR - Hard Start and No Start Diagnostics - Test Procedures - 15. Inlet Air Heater System

svcprocinfo.para: To determine if the Inlet Air Heater assembly is operating correctly

item.para: EST with MasterDiagnostics® software
EZ-Tech® interface cable
Digital Multimeter (DMM)
Amp Clamp

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

note.para: Inspect for damaged, loose or corroded terminals. Repair if necessary.

step1.para: Install Amp Clamp around one of the two feed wires.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.

figure.caption: Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.
From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.
Use the DMM and Amp Clamp to measure amperage. Record results on Diagnostic Form.
Repeat the above procedure for other feed wire circuit. Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If amperage draw for both circuits meets specifications, do not continue with test. The Inlet Air Heater system is working correctly.
If both circuits are not operational, confirm that the ECM is programmed and enabled for the Inlet Air Heater.
When a failed circuit has been identified, check that circuit only.
If amperage draw does not meet specification, continue with test 15.2 - Voltage at Element.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para: Connect DMM positive lead to the element terminal that is out of specification.
Connect DMM negative lead to the ground terminal.
Turn the ignition switch to ON.

figure.caption: Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.
Use the DMM to measure voltage.
Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If voltage is B+, do 15.3 Element Terminal Continuity.
If voltage is not B+, do 15.4 - Wiring Harness Continuity and Resistance.

svcsubproc.title: 15.3 - Element Terminal Continuity

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

svcsubproc.para: When the voltage at element is B+, check the continuity of the element terminal to ground.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to OFF.
Use DMM to check resistance.
Connect DMM positive lead to the element terminal that is not to specification.
Connect DMM negative lead to the ground terminal.
Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If the element does not have continuity to ground, replace the element.
If the element has continuity, verify the previous Inlet Air Heater test.

svcsubproc.title: 15.4 - Wiring Harness Continuity and Resistance

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

svcsubproc.para: When the voltage at element is not B+, measure the resistance (continuity) between the element and relay.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to OFF.
Use the DMM to check wiring harness continuity and measure resistance.
Connect DMM negative lead to the element terminal that is not B+.

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from element to the relay, to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Contact DMM positive lead to relay terminal.
Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If wiring resistance is > 5 Ω, repair or replace, if necessary.
If wiring resistance is < 5 Ω, continue with test 15.5 - Relay Operation.

warning.para: To avoid serious personal injury, possible death, or damage to the engine or vehicle, read all safety instructions in the "Safety Information" section of this manual.

step1.para: Connect DMM negative lead to the ground terminal, on the left side of crankcase or known, good ground in the cab.

note.para: Engines could be wired differently, having wiring harness connectors secured to different relay terminals. Trace wiring harness from battery to the relay, to be sure that the correct relay terminal is being tested.

step1.para: Contact DMM positive lead to relay terminal of battery feed to relay.
Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If DMM voltage at relay terminal is B+, continue with step 4 and measure relay output to element.
If voltage of relay terminal is less than B+, repair or replace wire from starter to relay. Retest to verify repair.

step1.para: Turn the ignition switch to ON.
Contact DMM positive lead to relay output terminal, relay to element.

figure.caption: Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater Output State Test

step1.para: Select Diagnostics from the menu bar.
Select Key-On Engine-Off Tests from the drop down menu.

note.para: When using the EST to do KOEO or KOER diagnostic tests, Standard Test is always selected and run first. If the ignition switch is not cycled, the Standard Test does not have to be run again.

step1.para: From the KOEO Diagnostics menu, select Glow Plug/Inlet Air Heater, then select Run to start the test.
Record results on Diagnostic Form.

item.para: If both relays are not operational, confirm that the ECM is programmed and enabled for the Inlet Air Heater.
If both relays are not operational and the ECM programming is correct, do the following checks in "IAH System" - Section 7:

para.hotlnk: Harness Resistance Checks - Relay to ECM
Harness Resistance Checks - Relay to 12-pin Connector

item.para: If voltage is not B+, do the following checks in "IAH System" - Section 7:

para.hotlnk: Harness Resistance Checks - Relay to ECM
Harness Resistance Checks - Relay to 12-pin Connector

item.para: If the control circuit wiring to the relay is correct, replace relay.
If voltage is B+, verify previous test results.
Check wiring from the relay to element. The wiring may have continuity and low resistance. However, a poor crimp, loose connector, or corrosion could prevent ability to handle circuit load.
Failed wiring harness or connection
Poor ground connection
Failed relay
Failed element
Failed ECM
ECM not programmed (inlet air heater)
